# RSS Promotion & Integration Strategy

Purpose: Increase discovery and subscription to the site's RSS feeds generated by Hugo (global, blog, category, tag). Provide clear UI affordances, metadata, and educational context for visitors.

## Existing Feeds (Auto-Generated by Hugo)
- Global site feed: `/index.xml`
- Blog section feed: `/blog/index.xml`
- Category feeds: `/categories/<category>/index.xml` (e.g., `/categories/architecture/index.xml`)
- Tag feeds: `/tags/<tag>/index.xml` (e.g., `/tags/hugo/index.xml`)

## Goals
- Make RSS visible in header, footer, blog list, and single posts.
- Provide a dedicated "Subscribe" / "Follow the Site" page explaining feed usage.
- Offer multiple subscription pathways (raw XML, feed readers, automation tools).
- Encourage power users (devs/architects) who value open standards over proprietary platforms.

## Front-End Integration Tasks
1. Header: Add an icon link (`<a href="/index.xml" aria-label="Global RSS feed" rel="alternate" type="application/rss+xml">RSS</a>`). Use a minimalist SVG icon styled with brand colors.
2. Footer: Repeat global feed link + short descriptive text ("Subscribe to updates via RSS").
3. Blog List (`layouts/blog/list.html`): Add a small RSS badge near the page title linking to `/blog/index.xml`.
4. Single Post (`layouts/blog/single.html`): Add a "Follow new posts" block at bottom referencing `/blog/index.xml`.
5. Category/Tag pages: Add a contextual feed link at top (e.g., "Subscribe to Architecture posts").
6. Add `<link rel="alternate" type="application/rss+xml" href="/index.xml" title="{{ .Site.Title }}"/>` to `head.html` (global) if not already injected by Hugo output formats (verify to avoid duplication).

## Dedicated Subscription Page
Create page (e.g., `content/subscribe/_index.md`) describing:
- What RSS is and why it matters (privacy, control, longevity).
- Links to: global feed, blog feed, example category feed, example tag feed.
- Instructions: "Copy a feed URL into your reader (NetNewsWire, Feedly, FreshRSS...)."
- Optional: Show how to automate with Zapier/IFTTT (feed → email or Teams channel).

## Icon & Visual Design
- SVG icon (simple radio waves or classic RSS glyph) using `#BA0C2F` fill and `#002F8B` accent.
- Hover state: subtle glow or border-left accent consistent with nav styling.
- Keep accessible contrast; ensure size ≥ 20px for tap targets.

## Accessibility
- Every RSS icon link must include `aria-label` describing feed purpose.
- Text alternative somewhere near icon ("RSS") for non-icon clarity.
- Avoid using only color to distinguish (include shape + label).

## SEO & Metadata
- Ensure `<link rel="alternate" type="application/rss+xml">` present for global feed.
- Provide `title` attribute matching site name or purpose.
- Optionally add `<meta name="rss-feed" content="/index.xml">` (non-standard, optional) for discoverability by custom scripts.

## Educational Copy (Examples)
Short tagline ideas:
- "Prefer open standards? Subscribe via RSS." 
- "Own your reading flow—add our feed to your reader." 
- "No tracking, no noise. Pure content in your reader."

## Implementation Order
1. Verify existing feed output and head metadata.
2. Add header + footer RSS links.
3. Add blog list and single post feed badges.
4. Create subscription page with explanatory content.
5. Add category/tag contextual feed links.
6. Introduce RSS icon SVG and CSS styling.
7. QA for accessibility + responsive layout.

## CSS Guidelines
- Reuse existing variables: `--norway-red`, `--norway-blue`.
- Icon container: `display: inline-flex; align-items: center; gap: 0.4rem;`.
- Hover: `filter: drop-shadow(0 0 4px rgba(186, 12, 47, 0.6));`.
- Match transitions: `transition: all var(--transition-normal);`.

## Testing Checklist
- [ ] Global feed reachable (`/index.xml` returns valid XML).
- [ ] Blog feed reachable (`/blog/index.xml`).
- [ ] Category/tag feed examples reachable.
- [ ] All RSS links have correct `rel` + `type` attributes where needed.
- [ ] Icon has accessible name (screen reader reads purpose).
- [ ] Subscription page renders without layout shift.
- [ ] Lighthouse Accessibility score remains ≥ 90.

## Future Enhancements
- Add JSON Feed (`/index.json`) for modern feed consumers.
- Generate dynamic OPML file bundling all category feeds.
- Provide `feed:` protocol link fallback (deprecated but harmless). 
- Integrate service worker notification (optional, not RSS but complementary).

## OPML (Optional Spec Outline)
Create `static/feeds.opml` listing category/tag feeds for quick bulk import.

## Automation Examples (Documentation Section)
- GitHub Actions: Use `curl` on `/index.xml` and diff to trigger tweet or LinkedIn post.
- Zapier: "New item in RSS" → "Send email digest".

## Maintenance Checklist
- [ ] New categories produce feed links automatically.
- [ ] No broken feed links in navigation after restructure.
- [ ] Subscription page updated when taxonomy changes.
